etymology.description: phonetic 爻 + semantic 子 ‘child’ + semantic 攵 ‘teaching cane; stick that represents authority’ — teaching a child.
etymology.interpretation: Combines sound from 爻 with the ideas of a child (子) and an instructing hand/stick (攴/攵), evoking guiding a child through instruction. Extends naturally to meanings like teaching, education, and religious teachings or doctrines.

examples.chinese: 他教我们中文(他教我們中文)。
老师耐心地教孩子写字(老師耐心地教孩子寫字)。
examples.pinyin: Lǎoshī nàixīn de jiāo háizi xiězì.
examples.english: The teacher patiently teaches the child to write.

examples.chinese: 这本书讲述佛教的历史(這本書講述佛教的歷史)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū jiǎngshù Fójiào de lìshǐ.
examples.english: This book describes the history of Buddhism.
